rows.NAME: Editor-Dialog with multiple widget groups
rows.DESCRIPTION: The first widget group has no caption, so it will not be visible as a group. The other two have captions. If wrapping, the content will be placed inside the first group.

rows.NAME: Precentual state machine without transition restrictions
Simple master data table
rows.DESCRIPTION: A DataTable with all visible attributes as columns and buttons to create, edit, copy and delete.

rows.NAME: Table with filters, sorters and buttons
rows.DESCRIPTION: A DataTable with placeholder for columns, filters and sorters and buttons to create, edit, copy and delete.

rows.NAME: Simple Tabs
rows.DESCRIPTION: Two tabs. If used as wrapper, the wrapped content will be added to the first tab

rows.NAME: Editor-Dialog with tabs for child objects
rows.DESCRIPTION: Tabbed dialog for master-detail object showing a "General" tab with an editor for the master object and a "Details" tab with a table of details objects. Wrapped content will be placed in the "General" tab.

rows.NAME: Responsive table with filters, sorters and buttons
rows.DESCRIPTION: A responsive table with placeholder for columns, filters and sorters and buttons to create, edit, copy and delete.

rows.NAME: Table without pagination
rows.DESCRIPTION: A simple table without pagination (showing all items at once)

rows.NAME: Table with pagination, but without total count
rows.DESCRIPTION: Not counting all items matching the current filters may greatly improve performance on large data sets

rows.NAME: Reuse/extend a page
rows.DESCRIPTION: Places the main widget of a page inside another widget or another page

rows.NAME: Centered KPI-Tiles
rows.DESCRIPTION: Several tiles in the middle of the screen. This can be a good starting point for a set of dashboards, where each tile navigates to a dashboard.

rows.NAME: Custom tile menu
rows.DESCRIPTION: Navigation menu with manually defined tiles. In contrast to NavTiles, each tile can have separate action, icon, etc.

rows.NAME: Simple GET Webservice (JSON)
rows.DESCRIPTION: Parameters will be sent in the URL. Use relative URLs to retrieve the host from the current connection of the data source. If the data source is not defined, the source of the action's object will be used.

rows.NAME: Simple POST Webservice (Form)
rows.DESCRIPTION: Parameters will be sent as form data. Use relative URLs to retrieve the host from the current connection of the data source. If the data source is not defined, the source of the action's object will be used.

rows.NAME: Simple POST Webservice (JSON)
rows.DESCRIPTION: Parameters will be sent JSON-object. Use relative URLs to retrieve the host from the current connection of the data source. If the data source is not defined, the source of the action's object will be used.

rows.NAME: Master-detail tables
rows.DESCRIPTION: The detail-table (bottom) is populated when a row in the master-table (top) is selected. Set the attribute_alias of the required filter in the detail-table to the relation to the master-table. If it does not point to the UID of the master-object, add a column to the value-property of the filter: e.g. master_table!key_column.

rows.NAME: MySQL Connection with relation matcher
rows.DESCRIPTION: The relation matcher attempts to create relations by looking for column names matching a regex to extract the related column (e.g. something like other_table_id in the example below)

rows.NAME: Dialog with tabs
rows.DESCRIPTION: A dialog with two tabs. If used as wrapper, the content will be added to the first tab.

rows.NAME: Widget Group with caption
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple widget group with a caption. Can be used as wrapper.

rows.NAME: Widget Group without caption
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple widget group without a caption/title. Can be used as wrapper.

rows.NAME: Widget Group with 2 columns
rows.DESCRIPTION: Wide widget group with two columns. Can be used as wrapper.

rows.NAME: ColorIndicator with a scale for numeric values
rows.DESCRIPTION: The text show will be colored as follows: values <= 10 will be red, values > 10 and <= 20 will be colored yellow, those > 20 and <= 99 will have no special color and values starting with 100 (actually > 99) will be green.

rows.NAME: ColorIndicator without text (streelight)
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple color-icon: green up-to 99, yellow up-to 299, red for 300 and up.

rows.NAME: ColorIndicator with text-values and backgroud-fill
rows.DESCRIPTION: Colors will be applied to text-background depending on the text shown: "Pending", "Error" and "Done" will be colored yellow, red and green, while all other texts will have transparent background.

rows.NAME: Small dialog
rows.DESCRIPTION: A small dialog with only two input inputs in a single column. Setting maximized=false, height=auto, etc. explicitly forces alle facades to behave the same instead of using their dialog-defaults.

rows.NAME: Simple empty dialog
rows.DESCRIPTION: A simple empty dialog with placeholders for widgets and buttons

rows.NAME: Console for a single command
rows.DESCRIPTION: A Console that executes a command when loaded and does not permit to enter any other commands - good to display the output of a preconfigured command or action.

rows.NAME: Console output dialog for CLI command
rows.DESCRIPTION: Opens a readonly console window and executes a command

rows.NAME: Split-Dashboard 1x3 + 1x3
rows.DESCRIPTION: 2 columns with 3 slots each. Good for KPI-tiles in the upper left. Adjust the height of the Tile-Panel to match the number of tile rows.

rows.NAME: Split-Dashboard 3x2
rows.DESCRIPTION: 2 rows of equal height with 3 slots each. All slots have equal size.

rows.NAME: Column chart
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple column chart with filters and sorters

rows.NAME: Bar chart
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple bar chart with filters and sorters

rows.NAME: Bar chart without axis caption
rows.DESCRIPTION: The Y-axis has not caption to save space. Make sure, y_attribute_alias of the series and attribute_alias of the axis match!

rows.NAME: Stacked column chart
rows.DESCRIPTION: To stack bars or columns, create multiple series and set stacked=tue for the first one in the stack. Theoretically, you can mix stacked and regular columns by giving each of them a separate stacked property.

rows.NAME: Pie chart
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple pie chart with filters

rows.NAME: Pie chart without header/footer
rows.DESCRIPTION: Just a pie - no header/footer

rows.NAME: Pie chart with aggregation
rows.DESCRIPTION: Pie chart over aggregated values - i.e. order types by number of orders. Make sure to aggregate over the text attribute! And give the value attribute an aggregator like `:SUM`.

rows.NAME: Run custom static SQL
rows.DESCRIPTION: Just perform some SQL queries on the current connection of a data source when the action is triggered

rows.NAME: Run custom SQL with placeholders
rows.DESCRIPTION: Run custom SQL with placeholders to be filled from input data of the action - i.e. [#ID#] will be replaced by the value in column "ID" of the input data. Multiple rows will trigger each query multiple times!
rows.UXON: {"alias":"exface.Core.CustomDataSourceQuery","data_source":"","input_object_alias":"","queries":["UPDATE table1 WHERE id = [#ID#]","UPDATE table2 WHERE foreign_key = [#ID#]"]}

rows.NAME: Update selected attributes with fixed values or formulas
rows.DESCRIPTION: Use `=1` for fixed numeric values, `='string'` for strings and formulas for calculated values.

rows.NAME: OR-Filter with a custom condition
rows.DESCRIPTION: The placeholder [#value#] will be replaced by the input value of the filter. You can use it in multiple conditions.

rows.NAME: Inline input group for value + currency
rows.DESCRIPTION: The caption will be inherited from the value-attribute

rows.NAME: Inline input group for dimensions (LxWxH)
rows.DESCRIPTION: Equal-width inputs for length, width and heigth

rows.NAME: Line chart
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple line chart with filters and sorters

rows.NAME: Area chart
rows.DESCRIPTION: Simple area chart with filters and sorters

rows.NAME: Smoothed line chart
rows.DESCRIPTION: Smoothed line chart (spline) with filters and sorters

rows.NAME: Child-object table
rows.DESCRIPTION: DataTable showing dependants (detail or child objects) based on an invisible filter

rows.NAME: DataTree with lazy loading
rows.DESCRIPTION: The tree will show only the root level initially, lazy loading every level when it's parent is expanded. Nodes of the root level are expected to have NULL values (tree_root_uid) in their parent-id-attributes.

rows.NAME: Fully expanded DataTree without lazy loading
Heatmap with custom colors
rows.DESCRIPTION: Plots color-highlighted values for every x/y coordinate. The color depends on the `value_attribute_alias` and will be calculated automatically using a gradient between the provided `colors`.

rows.NAME: Heatmap with discrete color groups
rows.DESCRIPTION: Plots color-highlighted values for every x/y coordinate. The color depends on the `value_attribute_alias`. The property `use_color_groups` of the `color_scale` results in 2 color groups between the `min` and `max` scale values along with automatic "above" and "below" color groups.

rows.NAME: Simple heatmap with autom. continuos color scale
rows.DESCRIPTION: Plots color-highlighted values for every x/y coordinate. The color depends on the `value_attribute_alias` and will be calculated automatically.

rows.NAME: FileList read-only
rows.DESCRIPTION: This widget will just show a list of files. The `mime_type_attribute_alias` enables facades to display icons for file types if possible.

rows.NAME: FileList with upload
rows.DESCRIPTION: To upload files the `upload` must be set to `true` and a `file_content_attribute_alias` must be specified (otherwise there's no place to upload). Use `upload_options` to apply restrictions to file size, type, name length, etc.

rows.NAME: FileList to upload attachments to master-object
rows.DESCRIPTION: Use this with master-detail widgets. The hidden column with a widget-link for value makes sure all newly uploaded files automatically get the id of the master object.
rows.UXON: {"widget_type":"FileList","object_alias":"","filename_attribute_alias":"","mime_type_attribute_alias":"","file_content_attribute_alias":"","upload_enabled":true,"filters":[{"attribute_alias":"\/\/ REPLACE WITH RELATION TO MASTER OBJECT!","required":true,"input_widget":{"widget_type":"InputHidden"}}],"columns":[{"attribute_alias":"\/\/ REPLACE WITH RELATION TO MASTER OBJECT!","hidden":true,"value":"=widget_link_to_id_of_master_object"}]}

rows.NAME: Editor-Dialog with table for simple child objects
rows.DESCRIPTION: Suitable for relatively simple object with few dependents (e.g. tags, groups, etc.). Instead of placing dependents in separate tabs, put tables with them inside the main editor screen.
rows.UXON: {"widget_type":"Dialog","widgets":[{"attribute_alias":"\/\/ REPLACE with UID of main object","id":"uid_field"},{"attribute_alias":""},{"caption":"\/\/ REPLACE with table caption","widget_type":"DataTableResponsive","object_alias":"\/\/ REPLACE with child object alias","width":"max","filters":[{"attribute_alias":"\/\/ REPLACE with relation to main object","required":true,"value":"=uid_field","input_widget":{"widget_type":"InputHidden"}}],"columns":[{"attribute_group_alias":"~VISIBLE"}],"buttons":[{"action_alias":"exface.Core.ShowObjectCreateDialog","caption":"=TRANSLATE('exface.Core', 'ACTION.GENERIC.ADD')"},{"action_alias":"exface.Core.DeleteObject","caption":"=TRANSLATE('exface.Core', 'ACTION.GENERIC.REMOVE')"}]}]}

rows.NAME: Generate an alias from a name
rows.DESCRIPTION: Will "sluggify" the first attribute and put it into the second one

rows.NAME: Generate an alias with namespace and custom character replacement
rows.DESCRIPTION: In addition to the simples case, a namespace will be appended, the result will be lowercased and whitespaces will be replaced by `-` instead of the default `_`.

rows.NAME: Ignore duplicates (e.g. for mappings)
rows.DESCRIPTION: Will ignore duplicate rows on multi-row create. This is handy for creating mappings between objects en-masse, where you only need to be sure, there is a mapping.

rows.NAME: Prevent delete of rows with certain ids
rows.DESCRIPTION: Place comma-separated list of ids in the `value` property. Replace `UID` with the id of your UID attribute

rows.NAME: Set flag on an object (e.g. disable/enable)
rows.DESCRIPTION: Replace the `0` in the `from` property with your desired value. Place the alias of the target attribute in the `to` property. Note: the input data MUST be based on the target meta object!

rows.NAME: Encrypted data
rows.DESCRIPTION: Will encrypt any data before sending to data source and decrypt it before showing. Just specify the the type of the raw (decrypted) data.
